description: Borrowed from Latin excretum, past participle of excerno, from ex- (“out”), and cerno (“separate”).

verbs.description: excrete (third-person singular simple present excretes, present participle excreting, simple past and past participle excreted)

entries.meaning: (biology, transitive, intransitive) To discharge material (including waste products) from a cell, body or system.
examples: Your open pores excrete sweat and dirt.
